intro: Lampocarya affinis, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, red-pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, often covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. Lampocarya affinis is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
